Description: Arsenical copper axe-head: with angular lugs. The three binding-holes are slightly misaligned, and there is an abandoned drill-hole just above the central perforation. The piece was quite thickly corroded before cleaning. One face bears a number of very lightly incised marks, the other a pattern of surface cracks and faults resulting from the process of manufacture. There are also small holes and faults in the cutting edge.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (62)
